message: Bob, I'm offering you my product for $1,400,000. It's a fair price considering its value and the potential it holds for your business.  Let me know your thoughts.
I appreciate your offer, but I think it's a bit steep. I'm willing to pay $1,200,000 for the product. I believe this is a fair price considering its value and my budget.

Bob, I understand your position, but $1,200,000 is simply too low for me.  I'm willing to come down a bit further, but I need to be closer to my initial offer.  I'm proposing $1,350,000 as a compromise.  Let's meet in the middle and close this deal.

I understand your concerns, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to meet you halfway between our offers, so I'll propose $1,325,000. I believe this is a fair compromise that works for both of us.

Bob, I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but $1,325,000 still falls short of what I need to make this deal work for me.  I'm willing to meet you halfway again and propose $1,337,500.  This is a very fair price, considering the value of the product and our previous offers.  Let's finalize this deal.

I understand your persistence, but I'm still not willing to go above $1,325,000. I'm willing to make one more concession and propose $1,322,500. I think this is a fair price considering the value of the product and our previous offers. I hope we can come to an agreement.
